message.content: We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The image provided in the question shows gram-negative diplococci, which are characteristic of Neisseria gonorrhoeae. This organism selectively grows on Thayer-Martin medium. Option A describes Shiga toxin produced by certain strains of E. coli. Option B describes Streptococcus mutans, which ferments maltose. Option C describes a reaction that occurs in patients with syphilis when treated with antibiotics.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The image provided shows gram-negative cocci, which are characteristic of Neisseria gonorrhoeae, the organism causing gonococcal arthritis. It selectively grows on Thayer-Martin medium, making option (D) the correct answer. Option (A) describes the mechanism of action of Shigella toxins, option (B) describes the characteristic of Streptococcus pyogenes, and option (C) describes the reaction seen with treatment of syphilis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The image shows gram-negative intracellular diplococci, which is characteristic of Neisseria gonorrhoeae. Option D is correct as Thayer-Martin medium is a selective medium used for the isolation of N. gonorrhoeae. Option A refers to diphtheria toxin, option B refers to Streptococcus mutans, and option C refers to Treponema pallidum.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The image provided shows gram-negative intracellular diplococci, which is characteristic of Neisseria gonorrhoeae. Option D is the correct answer, as Neisseria gonorrhoeae selectively grows on Thayer-Martin medium. Options A, B, and C are incorrect as they do not pertain to the characteristics of Neisseria gonorrhoeae.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The patient’s symptoms suggest gonococcal arthritis, which is caused by Neisseria gonorrhoeae. Among the options, only (D) is a characteristic feature of Neisseria gonorrhoeae- it selectively grows on Thayer-Martin medium. Option (A) is a characteristic feature of Shigella species, (B) is a characteristic feature of Streptococcus pneumoniae, and (C) is a characteristic feature of Treponema pallidum.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The image shows gram-negative diplococci, which suggests that the organism causing the condition is Neisseria gonorrhoeae. Neisseria gonorrhoeae selectively grows on Thayer-Martin medium. Option (A) describes diphtheria toxin produced by Corynebacterium diphtheriae. Option (B) describes Streptococcus pneumoniae, which ferments maltose. Option (C) describes the Jarisch-Herxheimer reaction caused by treatment for syphilis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The image shows gram-negative intracellular diplococci, which is characteristic of Neisseria gonorrhoeae. Option (D) describes the selective growth of Neisseria gonorrhoeae on Thayer-Martin medium. Option (A) describes the mode of action of diphtheria toxin, which is produced by Corynebacterium diphtheriae. Option (B) describes the ability of Streptococcus pneumoniae to ferment maltose. Option (C) describes the Jarisch-Herxheimer reaction, which is a cytokine reaction to the release of endotoxins following antibiotic treatment of syphilis.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The visualization of the synovial fluid shows gram-negative intracellular diplococci, which is characteristic of Neisseria gonorrhoeae. Option (D) is correct because Thayer-Martin medium is specifically designed for the isolation of N. gonorrhoeae. Option (A) refers to diphtheria toxin, (B) to Streptococcus pneumoniae, and (C) to Treponema pallidum, which cause completely different conditions.

We refer to Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The image provided shows gram-negative intracellular diplococci, which is characteristic of Neisseria gonorrhoeae. It selectively grows on Thayer-Martin medium. Options (A) and (C) refer to the characteristics of Corynebacterium diphtheriae and Treponema pallidum, respectively. Option (B) refers to the characteristics of Streptococcus pneumoniae.

We refer to the image provided and cross-check with Wikipedia articles on medicine for help. The image shows Gram-negative diplococci, which is characteristic of Neisseria gonorrhoeae. Among the options, only option D describes Thayer-Martin medium, which is a selective medium used to culture Neisseria gonorrhoeae. Option A describes diphtheria toxin, which is not related to this condition. Option B describes Streptococcus pneumoniae, which is not the causative agent of gonococcal arthritis. Option C describes the Jarisch-Herxheimer reaction, which is a reaction to treatment of syphilis, not gonorrhea.
